did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Center.
did.abstract: Edward Cosier (1865-1930) was an employee of the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad for over 40 years. His oldest son, Lionel Cosier (1891-1980) also worked for the railroad for over 40 years. For additional biographical information see folder 1, family history and genealogy.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Edward Henry Cosier was born in Woodbury, Connecticut in 1865. He spent over 40 years working for the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad, first as a fireman and later an engineer. In about 1899 he was involved in a train accident. Cosier died in Waterbury in 1930. His oldest son, Lionel, was born in Winsted, Connecticut, in 1891. He also spent over forty years working as an engineer for the NYNH&H Railroad. Lionel Cosier died in St. Petersburg, Florida, in 1980. For additional information see folder 1, “Family history and geneology.”

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Cosier Family Collection provides some insight, through family history, photographs and clippings, into the life of employees of the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad. Many of the images portray a working railroad company around the turn of the century.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to New England railroads. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I: Cosier Family Material (1879-1999) contains material compiled about the Cosier Family - with specific emphasis on Edward and Lionel Cosier.
Series II: NYNH&H Railroad Accident Images (1896-1912) contains postcards and photographs of various railroad accidents around the turn of the century.
